intro: Milium cimicinoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces distinctive, milky sap, which is a characteristic feature of many species in its family. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
